arm_group.description: Imatinib Mesylate Tablets, 400 mg. Once daily for 14 days.
Imatinib Mesylate Tablets, 400 mg. Once daily for 14 days.

brief_summary.textblock:
To characterize pharmacokinetic profile of test product  compared to that of the
      corresponding reference product in adult patients, who are diagnosed to have Chronic Myeloid
      Leukemia & Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor under Fed Conditions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Bioequivalence Study in Adult Patients Suffering From Chronic Myeloid Leukemia & Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor Under Fed Conditions

detailed_description.textblock:
To characterize pharmacokinetic profile of Imatinib Mesylate tablets EQ 400 mg base of
      Amneal Pharmaceuticals LLC, compared to that of the reference product - GLEEVEC® (imatinib
      mesylate) tablets 400 mg in adult patients, who are diagnosed to have CML or GIST and are
      presently receiving stable dose of imatinib mesylate tablets 400 mg, and assess their
      bioequivalence.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18 to 55 years (both inclusive) and either sex

          -  Diagnosed case of Philadelphia chromosome positive (Ph+) CML patients in chronic
             phase or GIST and presently being treated with imatinib 400 mg tablets.

          -  Willing to give written informed consent for participation in the study as well as
             willing and able to comply with study visit schedule and other protocol requirements.

          -  Female patients of child bearing potential (except for those who have completed one
             year since menopause or have gone through hysterectomy or bilateral tubal ligation)
             must have negative serum pregnancy test at the screening, negative urine pregnancy
             test on check in to housing, must be non-lactating at screening and must agree to use
             effective contraception (barrier or hormonal) for the study period.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of hypersensitivity to imatinib mesylate or to any of the excipients as
             judged by investigator.

          -  Patient of CML receiving treatment in Myeloid Blast Crisis or Accelerated Phase

          -  Abnormal laboratory results as below:

          -  History of a heart failure, renal insufficiency, hypereosinophilic syndrome (HES),
             myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)/ myeloproliferative disease (MPD) or acute systemic
             mastocytosis (ASM).

          -  History of therapy with any of the following as per timelines before randomization:
             inducers of CYP3A4 activity and  inhibitors of CYP3A4 activity, within 14 days,
             investigational product/device within last one month

          -  Alcohol or any drug dependence within past one year.

          -  Blood donation/loss exceeding 200 ml within last 60 days.

intervention.description: Brown, oval, scored, film coated, beveled edge tablet. Debossed with AN on scored side and 795 on the other side.
Very dark yellow to brownish orange, film-coated tablets, ovaloid, biconvex with bevelled edges, debossed with "400" on one side with score on the other side, and "SL" on each side of the score.

facility.name: Srinivasam Cancer Care Hospitals India Pvt.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open Label, Two-Treatment, Multiple Dose, Steady State, Two-period, Cross-over, Multi-Centre Comparative Bioequivalence Study of Imatinib Mesylate Tablet 400 mg of Amneal Pharmaceuticals, USA With GLEEVEC® (Imatinib Mesylate) Tablets 400 mg Distributed by Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corporation, East Hanover, New Jersey 07936 in Adult Patients Suffering From Chronic Myeloid Leukemia & Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor Under Fed Conditions

oversight_info.authority: India: Drugs Controller General of India

primary_outcome.description: Peak maximum concentration over dosing interval in the steady state
The area under the blood concentration curve versus time, calculated by the trapezoid method, from zero time to the dose interval (tau) in the steady state

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The time to reach such peak over dosing interval in the steady state
Minimum concentration established at each dose interval end of the steady state
Average concentration in the steady state (= AUC0-tau / tau)
Swing in steady state pharmacokinetics, calculated as (CmaxSS-CminSS)/ CminSS
Degree of fluctuation in the steady state pharmacokinetics, calculated as (Cmax-Cmin)/CavSS

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
